intro: Seriphidium longilobum, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to harsh environments, with deep taproots that allow it to access groundwater. Seriphidium longilobum is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
